009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * Simple global thresholder which uses the mean pixel value as the threshold.
015 * See Sec. 9.1.2 of [1] for additional details (Eq. 9.10).
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
019 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
020 * </p>
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 * @version 2022/08/01
024 */
025public class MeanThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
026        
027        public MeanThresholder() {
028        }
029
030        @Override
031        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
032                // calculate mean of the entire image:
033                int K = h.length;
034                int N = 0;
035                
036                long sum = 0;
037                for (int i = 0; i < K; i++) {
038                        N += h[i];
039                        sum += i * h[i];
040                }
041                
042                int mean = (int) Math.floor((double)sum / N);   // important to use floor if only two pixel values
043
044                // count resulting background pixels:
045                int n0 = 0;
046                for (int i = 0; i <= mean; i++) {
047                        n0 += h[i];
048                }
049                
050                // determine if background or foreground is empty:
051                int q = (n0 < N) ? mean : -1;
052                return q;
053        }
054}
